result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Udell L Pugh

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 15 pages) commencing 08-01-2022 by Amy De La Rosa.

Defendant Udell L Pugh appeared by video.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Udell L Pugh.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned to branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-15-22

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.

Defendant Udell L Pugh in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case number 18CF1165.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Ayala.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Udell L Pugh in court with Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Al-Henaey is newly appointed and needs time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Udell L Pugh in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Udell L Pugh in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Udell L Pugh appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Udell L Pugh
Current: 4326 N 39th St, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 06-24-2022)
Prior: 4918 North 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
